page.title: 09TWO GAMES CHILDREN PLAY
page.content: RED POISON Red Poison is a game in which someone holds out a hand (with fingers apart) and other children hold on to a finger. The person who holds out their hand tells a story, and somewhere in that story they have to say "Red Poison!" When they say it the people who are holding the fingers run away and the other person chases and catches them. Then you start again with the person whom they caught. RED ROVER Red Rover is a game in which you have two teams, which stand opposite each other. One team says "Red Rover, Red Rover send ? over" and then that person runs over to the other team and tries to break through their hands. If he fails he has to join the other team. If he does break through he is allowed to return to his own team.
